input: Question: how was rnf188 phosphorylation detected experimentally? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "project" "id" int, "project_id" text, "project_title" text, "species" text, "publication_date" text, "submission_type" text, "tissues" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide" "id" int, "peptide_sequence" text, "peptide_start" int, "peptide_end" int, "peptide_modification_position" int, "project_frequency" int, "uniprot_position" int, "score" real, "l_protein_id" int, "l_project_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide_has_modification" "id" int, "l_peptide_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_modification_id" int from "modification" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'Q9NRZ9'
question: how was rnf188 phosphorylation detected experimentally?

input: Question: find DEAD box protein 3 phospho sites in surface accessible Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "structure" "id" int, "pdb_id" text, "resolution" real, "stoichiometry" text, "method" text, "interfacing_molecule" text, "uniprot_position" int, "residue" text, "secondary_structure" text, "chain_id" text, "pdb_position" int, "accessible_surface_area" real, "burried_surface_area" real, "css" real, "conserved_scale" real, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'O00571' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: find DEAD box protein 3 phospho sites in surface accessible

SELECT pm.uniprot_position, pm.modified_residue, pm.evidence, pm.number_projects 
                                FROM protein_modification pm 
                                JOIN protein p ON pm.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                JOIN modification m ON pm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                WHERE p.accession = 'O75390' AND m.unimod_modification_name = 'Formyl'
question: CISY formylation pattern

input: Question: which instruments detect agat phosphorylation? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'P50440'
question: which instruments detect agat phosphorylation?

input: Question: which instruments detect c-Cbl-like protein phosphorylation? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, m.modified_residue, m.evidence, m.functional_score,
                                                     pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                                     FROM modification m 
                                                     JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                                     JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON m.id = phm.l_modification_id
                                                     JOIN peptide pe ON phm.l_peptide_id = pe.id
                                                     JOIN project pr ON pe.l_project_id = pr.id
                                                     WHERE p.accession = 'Q75N03' AND m.uniprot_position = 89
question: which instruments detect c-Cbl-like protein phosphorylation?

input: Question: lymphoid specific helicase phosphorylation sites - structured or disordered? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "structure" "id" int, "pdb_id" text, "resolution" real, "stoichiometry" text, "method" text, "interfacing_molecule" text, "uniprot_position" int, "residue" text, "secondary_structure" text, "chain_id" text, "pdb_position" int, "accessible_surface_area" real, "burried_surface_area" real, "css" real, "conserved_scale" real, primary key: "id" [SEP] "dynamine_predictions" "id" int, "residue" text, "position" int, "secondary_structure" text, "disordered_propensity" real, "backbone_dynamics" real, "early_folding" real, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'Q9NRZ9' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: lymphoid specific helicase phosphorylation sites - structured or disordered?

Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "entry_name" text, "protein_name" text, "protein_length" int, primary key: "id" [SEP] "protein_modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "number_peptidoforms" int, "number_projects" int, "l_protein_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, "l_uniprot_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "unimod_modification_name" text, "unimod_id" int, "modification_type" text, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, m.modified_residue, m.evidence, m.functional_score

input: Question: which c-Cbl-like protein phospho sites are in buried? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'Q75N03' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: which c-Cbl-like protein phospho sites are in buried?

input: Question: how was CS phosphorylation detected experimentally? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "project" "id" int, "project_id" text, "project_title" text, "species" text, "publication_date" text, "submission_type" text, "tissues" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide" "id" int, "peptide_sequence" text, "peptide_start" int, "peptide_end" int, "peptide_modification_position" int, "project_frequency" int, "uniprot_position" int, "score" real, "l_protein_id" int, "l_project_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide_has_modification" "id" int, "l_peptide_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_modification_id" int from "modification" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'O75390'
question: how was CS phosphorylation detected experimentally?

Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "entry_name" text, "protein_name" text, "protein_length" int, primary key: "id" [SEP] "protein_modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "number_peptidoforms" int, "number_projects" int, "l_protein_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, "l_uniprot_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "unimod_modification_name" text, "unimod_id" int, "modification_type" text, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT COUNT(*) as phospho_count FROM modification m 
                                         JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                         WHERE p.accession = 'P02545' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: how do lamin A/C and DDX3X differ in phosphorylation?

input: Question: experimental approaches for DEAD box protein 3 phosphorylation Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "project" "id" int, "project_id" text, "project_title" text, "species" text, "publication_date" text, "submission_type" text, "tissues" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide" "id" int, "peptide_sequence" text, "peptide_start" int, "peptide_end" int, "peptide_modification_position" int, "project_frequency" int, "uniprot_position" int, "score" real, "l_protein_id" int, "l_project_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide_has_modification" "id" int, "l_peptide_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_modification_id" int from "modification" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, m.modified_residue, m.evidence, m.functional_score,
                                                     pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                                     FROM modification m 
                                                     JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                                     JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON m.id = phm.l_modification_id
                                                     JOIN peptide pe ON phm.l_peptide_id = pe.id
                                                     JOIN project pr ON pe.l_project_id = pr.id
                                                     WHERE p.accession = 'O00571' AND m.uniprot_position = 61
question: experimental approaches for DEAD box protein 3 phosphorylation

input: Question: which lamin-A phospho sites are in structured regions? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "structure" "id" int, "pdb_id" text, "resolution" real, "stoichiometry" text, "method" text, "interfacing_molecule" text, "uniprot_position" int, "residue" text, "secondary_structure" text, "chain_id" text, "pdb_position" int, "accessible_surface_area" real, "burried_surface_area" real, "css" real, "conserved_scale" real, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'P02545' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: which lamin-A phospho sites are in structured regions?

input: Question: find DDX3X phospho sites in disordered Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "dynamine_predictions" "id" int, "residue" text, "position" int, "secondary_structure" text, "disordered_propensity" real, "backbone_dynamics" real, "early_folding" real, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'O00571' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: find DDX3X phospho sites in disordered

Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "project" "id" int, "project_id" text, "project_title" text, "species" text, "publication_date" text, "submission_type" text, "tissues" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide" "id" int, "peptide_sequence" text, "peptide_start" int, "peptide_end" int, "peptide_modification_position" int, "project_frequency" int, "uniprot_position" int, "score" real, "l_protein_id" int, "l_project_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide_has_modification" "id" int, "l_peptide_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_modification_id" int from "modification" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'Q86US8'

Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "structure" "id" int, "pdb_id" text, "resolution" real, "stoichiometry" text, "method" text, "interfacing_molecule" text, "uniprot_position" int, "residue" text, "secondary_structure" text, "chain_id" text, "pdb_position" int, "accessible_surface_area" real, "burried_surface_area" real, "css" real, "conserved_scale" real, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'O75390' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: citrate synthase phosphorylation structural analysis?

input: Question: detection methods for lymphoid specific helicase phosphorylation Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "project" "id" int, "project_id" text, "project_title" text, "species" text, "publication_date" text, "submission_type" text, "tissues" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide" "id" int, "peptide_sequence" text, "peptide_start" int, "peptide_end" int, "peptide_modification_position" int, "project_frequency" int, "uniprot_position" int, "score" real, "l_protein_id" int, "l_project_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "peptide_has_modification" "id" int, "l_peptide_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_modification_id" int from "modification" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'Q9NRZ9'

input: Question: where are c-Cbl-like protein phospho sites structurally? target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'Q75N03' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'

input: Question: therapeutic target potential of ddx3x S102 phosphorylation Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, m.modified_residue, m.evidence, m.functional_score,
                                                     pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                                     FROM modification m 
                                                     JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                                     JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON m.id = phm.l_modification_id
                                                     JOIN peptide pe ON phm.l_peptide_id = pe.id
                                                     JOIN project pr ON pe.l_project_id = pr.id
                                                     WHERE p.accession = 'O00571' AND m.uniprot_position = 102
question: therapeutic target potential of ddx3x S102 phosphorylation

input: Question: which lymphoid specific helicase phospho sites are in buried? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'Q9NRZ9' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: which lymphoid specific helicase phospho sites are in buried?

                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id

Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "entry_name" text, "protein_name" text, "protein_length" int, primary key: "id" [SEP] "protein_modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "number_peptidoforms" int, "number_projects" int, "l_protein_id" int, "l_modification_id" int, "l_uniprot_modification_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "unimod_modification_name" text, "unimod_id" int, "modification_type" text, primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT pm.uniprot_position, pm.modified_residue, pm.evidence, pm.number_projects 
                                FROM protein_modification pm

input: Question: are lmna phospho sites in loops? Schema: "protein" "id" int, "accession" text, "uniprot_id" text, "protein_name" text, primary key: "id" [SEP] "modification" "id" int, "uniprot_position" int, "modification_name" text, "modified_residue" text, "evidence" text, "source" text, "functional_score" real, "reference" text, "singly_phosphorylated" int, "l_protein_id" int, foreign_key: "l_protein_id" int from "protein" "id", primary key: "id"
target:
SELECT m.uniprot_position, s.secondary_structure, s.accessible_surface_area, 
                                   dp.disordered_propensity, dp.backbone_dynamics
                            FROM modification m 
                            JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                            LEFT JOIN structure s ON m.uniprot_position = s.uniprot_position AND s.l_protein_id = p.id
                            LEFT JOIN dynamine_predictions dp ON m.uniprot_position = dp.position AND dp.l_protein_id = p.id
                            WHERE p.accession = 'P02545' AND m.modification_name = 'phosphorylation'
question: are lmna phospho sites in loops?

target:
SELECT DISTINCT pr.project_id, pr.project_title, pr.tissues 
                                             FROM project pr 
                                             JOIN peptide pe ON pr.id = pe.l_project_id 
                                             JOIN peptide_has_modification phm ON pe.id = phm.l_peptide_id 
                                             JOIN modification m ON phm.l_modification_id = m.id 
                                             JOIN protein p ON m.l_protein_id = p.id 
                                             WHERE p.accession = 'P02545'
